RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_Mode_Display
RefParameter.Description:
Normal SPI Mode
LF Master SPI Mode :
Dedicated to low-power use-cases, using low-speed sensors.
To guarantee optimal timing performances, the application must select the same clock than the one provided to the external sensor for each SITFx
Manchester Mode : Decoded data and clock signals are recovered from serial stream after Manchester decoding.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_Manchester_Front

PossibleValue.Comment: Rising edge means 0 and Falling Edge means 1
Rising edge means 1 and Falling Edge means 0

RefParameter.Description: Means of edge for Manchester Mode

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_Threshold
RefParameter.Description: Manchester symbol threshold.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_Threshold
RefParameter.Description: SPI threshold for clock absence detection

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_ClockSource

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate Common Clock 0 in the Common Clocks Mode
Activate Common Clock 1 in the Common Clocks Mode

RefParameter.Description: Select which common clock source is used for the Serial Interface SITF

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_ClockSource
RefParameter.Description: Warning : The clock source used by the SITF is defined only in the Mode window. Here is just for information.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_ClockSource
RefParameter.Description: Warning : The clock source used by the SITF is defined only in the Mode window. Here is just for information.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF0_ClockSource
RefParameter.Description: Warning : The clock source used by the SITF is defined only in the Mode window. Here is just for information.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SITF_Choice

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 0 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 1 (if exists) to make it available

RefParameter.Description: Selection of the serial interface (SITF) to use for the current Filter configuration (DFLT) as well as the related Short Circuit Detector (SCD)

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SITF_Choice

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 0 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 1 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 2 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 3 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 4 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 5 to make it available

RefParameter.Description: Selection of the serial interface (SITF) to use for the current Filter configuration (DFLT) as well as the related Short Circuit Detector (SCD)

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_FilterBistreamFront
RefParameter.Description: Select the bitstream to use. Indeed for each SITF the both streams are available (one defined on the rising edge, one defined on the falling edge).

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_Data_Source

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate at least one Serial Interface in one instance
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC1 + Desactivate SCD0
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC2 + Desactivate SCD0

RefParameter.Description:
The source of the digital filter (DFLT) can be selected between the two following:
• data coming from the Bitstream matrix (then select which SITF and the front used in the additionnal parameters)
• data coming from the ADC interface 1 or 2

To use the data source coming from ADC interface 1 or 2, these 3 conditions have to be checked :
- 1 : ADC1 (or ADC2) has to be activated with the Conversion Data Management Parameter set to "MDF mode" value
- 2 : the SCD (Short Circuit Detector) mode has to be desactivated

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_Data_Source

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate at least one Serial Interface in one instance
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC1 + Desactivate SCD0

RefParameter.Description:
The source of the digital filter (DFLT) can be selected between the two following:
• data coming from the Bitstream matrix (then select which SITF and the front used in the additionnal parameters)
• data coming from the ADC interface 1

To use the data source coming from ADC interface 1, these 3 conditions have to be checked :
- 1 : ADC1 has to be activated with the Conversion Data Management Parameter set to "MDF mode" value
- 2 : the SCD (Short Circuit Detector) mode has to be desactivated

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_CIC_Mode
RefParameter.Description:
The Cascaded-Integrator-Comb (CIC) filter is a high-resolution low-pass decimation filter
CIC filter can be configured with Sinc4 or Sinc5 order

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_CIC_Mode

PossibleValue.Comment: Two filters, main filter in FastSinc order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc1 order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc2 order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc3 order

RefParameter.Description:
The Cascaded-Integrator-Comb (CIC) filters are an efficient implementation of low-pass filters, often used for decimation and interpolation.
CIC filter can be configured:
– in single CIC filter with Sinc4 or Sinc5 order (for high-resolution low-pass decimation filter usually selected for audio applications, such as speech capture from digital microphones)
– in two CIC filters with Sinc1, Sinc2, Sinc3 or FastSinc order (to offer a main filter path for acquisition and an auxiliary filter for fast-event generation (for the out-off-limit detector - OLD))

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_ReshapeFilterActivation
RefParameter.Description: Activation of reshaping filter mainly dedicated to the audio application but also usable in other applications.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_ReshapeFilterDecimationRatio
RefParameter.Description: The samples at the reshape filter output can be decimated by four (4) or not (1)

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_HighPassFilterActivation
RefParameter.Description:
"The high-pass filter suppresses the low-frequency content from the final output data stream in case of continuous conversion mode.
This filter is useful when there is parasitic low-frequency noise (or DC signal) in the input data source and it must be removed from the final data."

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_HighPassCutOffFrequency
RefParameter.Description:
Cut-off freqency of the high-pass filter :
FPCM represents the sampling frequency at HPF input

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_IntegratorActivation
RefParameter.Description: The Integrator performs additional decimation and a resolution increase of data coming from the digital filter.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_IntegratorValue
RefParameter.Description: Value is the amount of integrated values.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_IntegratorOutputDivision
RefParameter.Description: In order to control the data width at the integrator output, the resulting data can be divided by 1, 4, 32 or 128.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADDetector
RefParameter.Description: Sound activity detector mode.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADFrameSize
RefParameter.Description: Size of one frame to compute short-term signal level.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADTriggerEvent

PossibleValue.Comment: when Sound Activity Detector enters the MONITOR state
when Sound Activity Detector enters or exits the DETECT state

RefParameter.Description:
Sound trigger event configuration :
An event indicates when the Sound Activity Detector (SAD) enters and/or exits the DETECT state. This event is used to generate an interrupt when a sound is detected or when a sound is no longer detected.
Either the application receives an event only when the SAD enters the DETECT state (or MONITOR state).
Or the application receives an event when the SAD enters or exits the DETECT state.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADHangoverWindow
RefParameter.Description: Hangover time window in frames

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADHangoverWindow
RefParameter.Comment: Number of frames for hangover time window

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADLearningFrames
RefParameter.Description: Number of learning frames for the first estimation of noise level.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADAmbientNoiseSlope
RefParameter.Description: Ambient noise slope control.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADSignalNoiseThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Signal to noise threshold.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SADSoundLevelInterrupt
RefParameter.Description: This interrupt is mainly used for debug purpose.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_AcquisitionMode
RefParameter.Description:
Asynchronous, continuous mode allows the application to start a continuous acquisition
Asynchronous, single-shot mode allows the application to start the acquisition of one sample
Synchronous, continuous mode allows the application to start a continuous acquisition by using trigger source
Synchronous, single-shot mode allows the application to start a single acquisition by using trigger source
Window, continuous mode allows the application to start or stop a continuous acquisition by consecutive edges of using trigger source
Window, snapshot (for MDF) mode allows the application to store when a trigger occurs, the last valid sample, the current decimation value of CIC and the sample counter of the integrator are stored whereas the DFLT is continuously acquiring the samples

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_TriggerSource
RefParameter.Description:
Digital filter trigger signal selection, select which external signals trigger for the corresponding filter
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_TriggerSource

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Instance0 -> OLD0 has to be configured
ADF1 Sound Activity Detection has to be configured

RefParameter.Description:
Digital filter trigger signal selection, select which external signals trigger for the corresponding filter
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_TriggerEdge
RefParameter.Description:
Edge to use on the trigger source.
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SCDActivation

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: SCD not available when Data Source is connected to ADC interface

RefParameter.Description: The SCD detects, with a very fast response time, if an analog signal reached saturated values (out-of-full scale ranges) and remained on this value for a given time.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SCDThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Threshold defines the max consecutive 1's or 0's which will generate an event.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_SCDBreakSignal
RefParameter.Description: Break signal defines the signal to use when the threshold is reached.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_OLDActivation

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Change CIC Mode of the DFLT (cannot be Sinc4 or Sinc5)

RefParameter.Description:
"The OLD triggers an event when a signal reaches or crosses given maximum and minimum threshold values.
The generated event drives a break signals when conditions are met.
Warning : The OLD can be used only if the CIC filter is configured in motor and sensing mode (not vailable for CIC Mode = Sinc4 or Sinc5)"

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_OLDCicMode
RefParameter.Description: CIC filter can be configured with Sinc1, Sinc2, Sinc3 or FastSinc order.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_OLDDecimationRatio
RefParameter.Description: Decimation ration of the OLD CIC filter.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_OLDEventConfig
RefParameter.Description: Define when the OLD generates an event.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_OLDBreakSignal
RefParameter.Description: Break signal defines the signal to use when the threshold is reached.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_OLDHighThreshold
RefParameter.Description:
High Threshold for out-of-limit detector. Has to be strictly greater than Low Threshold
Min = Low Threshold + 1
Max = 33554431

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT0_OLDLowThreshold
RefParameter.Description:
Low Threshold for out-of-limit detector. Has to be strictly lower than High Threshold
Min = -33554432
Max = High Threshold - 1

An event indicates when the Sound Activity Detector (SAD) enters and/or exits the DETECT state. This event is used to generate an interrupt when a sound is detected or when a sound is no longer detected.
Either the application receives an event only when the SAD enters the DETECT state (or MONITOR state).
Or the application receives an event when the SAD enters or exits the DETECT state.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SADHangoverWindow
RefParameter.Description: Hangover time window in frames

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SADHangoverWindow
RefParameter.Comment: Number of frames for hangover time window

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SADLearningFrames
RefParameter.Description: Number of learning frames for the first estimation of noise level.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SADAmbientNoiseSlope
RefParameter.Description: Ambient noise slope control.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SADSignalNoiseThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Signal to noise threshold.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SADSoundLevelInterrupt
RefParameter.Description: This interrupt is mainly used for debug purpose.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_AcquisitionMode
RefParameter.Description:
Asynchronous, continuous mode allows the application to start a continuous acquisition
Asynchronous, single-shot mode allows the application to start the acquisition of one sample
Synchronous, continuous mode allows the application to start a continuous acquisition by using trigger source
Synchronous, single-shot mode allows the application to start a single acquisition by using trigger source
Window, continuous mode allows the application to start or stop a continuous acquisition by consecutive edges of using trigger source
Window, snapshot mode allows the application to store when a trigger occurs, the last valid sample, the current decimation value of CIC and the sample counter of the integrator are stored whereas the DFLT is continuously acquiring the samples

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_TriggerSource
RefParameter.Description:
Digital filter trigger signal selection, select which external signals trigger for the corresponding filter
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_TriggerSource

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Instance2 -> OLD2 has to be configured
ADF1 Sound Activity Detection has to be configured

RefParameter.Description:
Digital filter trigger signal selection, select which external signals trigger for the corresponding filter
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_TriggerEdge
RefParameter.Description:
Edge to use on the trigger source.
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SCDActivation

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: SCD not available when Data Source is connected to ADC interface

RefParameter.Description: The SCD detects, with a very fast response time, if an analog signal reached saturated values (out-of-full scale ranges) and remained on this value for a given time.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SCDThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Threshold defines the max consecutive 1's or 0's which will generate an event.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_SCDBreakSignal
RefParameter.Description: Break signal defines the signal to use when the threshold is reached.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_OLDActivation

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Change CIC Mode of the DFLT (cannot be Sinc4 or Sinc5)

RefParameter.Description:
"The OLD triggers an event when a signal reaches or crosses given maximum and minimum threshold values.
The generated event drives a break signals when conditions are met.
Warning : The OLD can be used only if the CIC filter is configured in motor and sensing mode (not vailable for CIC Mode = Sinc4 or Sinc5)"

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_OLDCicMode
RefParameter.Description: CIC filter can be configured with Sinc1, Sinc2, Sinc3 or FastSinc order.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_OLDDecimationRatio
RefParameter.Description: Decimation ration of the OLD CIC filter.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_OLDEventConfig
RefParameter.Description: Define when the OLD generates an event.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_OLDBreakSignal
RefParameter.Description: Break signal defines the signal to use when the threshold is reached.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_OLDHighThreshold
RefParameter.Description:
High Threshold for out-of-limit detector. Has to be strictly greater than Low Threshold
Min = Low Threshold + 1
Max = 33554431

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT2_OLDLowThreshold
RefParameter.Description:
Low Threshold for out-of-limit detector. Has to be strictly lower than High Threshold
Min = -33554432
Max = High Threshold - 1

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF3_Mode_Display
RefParameter.Description:
Normal SPI Mode
LF Master SPI Mode :
Dedicated to low-power use-cases, using low-speed sensors.
To guarantee optimal timing performances, the application must select the same clock than the one provided to the external sensor for each SITFx
Manchester Mode : Decoded data and clock signals are recovered from serial stream after Manchester decoding.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF3_Manchester_Front

PossibleValue.Comment: Rising edge means 0 and Falling Edge means 1
Rising edge means 1 and Falling Edge means 0

RefParameter.Description: Means of edge for Manchester Mode

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF3_Threshold
RefParameter.Description: Manchester symbol threshold.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF3_Threshold
RefParameter.Description: SPI threshold for clock absence detection

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF3_ClockSource
RefParameter.Description: Warning : The clock source used by the SITF is defined only in the Mode window. Here is just for information.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF3_ClockSource
RefParameter.Description: Warning : The clock source used by the SITF is defined only in the Mode window. Here is just for information.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_SITF3_ClockSource
RefParameter.Description: Warning : The clock source used by the SITF is defined only in the Mode window. Here is just for information.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_SITF_Choice

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 0 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 1 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 2 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 3 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 4 to make it available
Activate the related SITF in the Instance Mode 5 to make it available

RefParameter.Description: Selection of the serial interface (SITF) to use for the current Filter configuration (DFLT) as well as the related Short Circuit Detector (SCD)

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_FilterBistreamFront
RefParameter.Description: Select the bitstream to use. Indeed for each SITF the both streams are available (one defined on the rising edge, one defined on the falling edge).

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_Data_Source

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate at least one Serial Interface in one instance
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC1 + Desactivate SCD3

RefParameter.Description:
The source of the digital filter (DFLT) can be selected between the two following:
• data coming from the Bitstream matrix (then select which SITF and the front used in the additionnal parameters)
• data coming from the ADC interface 1

To use the data source coming from ADC interface 1, these 3 conditions have to be checked :
- 1 : ADC1 has to be activated with the Conversion Data Management Parameter set to "MDF mode" value
- 2 : the SCD (Short Circuit Detector) mode has to be desactivated

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_Data_Source

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate at least one Serial Interface in one instance
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC1 + Desactivate SCD3
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC2 + Desactivate SCD3

RefParameter.Description:
The source of the digital filter (DFLT) can be selected between the two following:
• data coming from the Bitstream matrix (then select which SITF and the front used in the additionnal parameters)
• data coming from the ADC interface 1 or 2

To use the data source coming from ADC interface 1 or 2, these 3 conditions have to be checked :
- 1 : ADC1 (or ADC2) has to be activated with the Conversion Data Management Parameter set to "MDF mode" value
- 2 : the SCD (Short Circuit Detector) mode has to be desactivated

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_CIC_Mode

PossibleValue.Comment: Two filters, main filter in FastSinc order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc1 order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc2 order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc3 order

RefParameter.Description:
The Cascaded-Integrator-Comb (CIC) filters are an efficient implementation of low-pass filters, often used for decimation and interpolation.
CIC filter can be configured:
– in single CIC filter with Sinc4 or Sinc5 order (for high-resolution low-pass decimation filter usually selected for audio applications, such as speech capture from digital microphones)
– in two CIC filters with Sinc1, Sinc2, Sinc3 or FastSinc order (to offer a main filter path for acquisition and an auxiliary filter for fast-event generation (for the out-off-limit detector - OLD))

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_ReshapeFilterActivation
RefParameter.Description: Activation of reshaping filter mainly dedicated to the audio application but also usable in other applications.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_ReshapeFilterDecimationRatio
RefParameter.Description: The samples at the reshape filter output can be decimated by four (4) or not (1)

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_HighPassFilterActivation
RefParameter.Description:
"The high-pass filter suppresses the low-frequency content from the final output data stream in case of continuous conversion mode.
This filter is useful when there is parasitic low-frequency noise (or DC signal) in the input data source and it must be removed from the final data."

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_HighPassCutOffFrequency
RefParameter.Description:
Cut-off freqency of the high-pass filter :
FPCM represents the sampling frequency at HPF input

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_IntegratorActivation
RefParameter.Description: The Integrator performs additional decimation and a resolution increase of data coming from the digital filter.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_IntegratorValue
RefParameter.Description: Value is the amount of integrated values.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_IntegratorOutputDivision
RefParameter.Description: In order to control the data width at the integrator output, the resulting data can be divided by 1, 4, 32 or 128.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_SADDetector
RefParameter.Description: Sound activity detector mode.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_SADFrameSize
RefParameter.Description: Size of one frame to compute short-term signal level.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT3_SADTriggerEvent

PossibleValue.Comment: when Sound Activity Detector enters the MONITOR state
when Sound Activity Detector enters or exits the DETECT state

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate at least one Serial Interface in one instance
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC1 + Desactivate SCD5
Activate MDF mode value in Conversion Data Management Parameter of ADC2 + Desactivate SCD5

RefParameter.Description:
The source of the digital filter (DFLT) can be selected between the two following:
• data coming from the Bitstream matrix (then select which SITF and the front used in the additionnal parameters)
• data coming from the ADC interface 1 or 2

To use the data source coming from ADC interface 1 or 2, these 3 conditions have to be checked :
- 1 : ADC1 (or ADC2) has to be activated with the Conversion Data Management Parameter set to "MDF mode" value
- 2 : the SCD (Short Circuit Detector) mode has to be desactivated

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_CIC_Mode

PossibleValue.Comment: Two filters, main filter in FastSinc order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc1 order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc2 order
Two filters, main filter in Sinc3 order

RefParameter.Description:
The Cascaded-Integrator-Comb (CIC) filters are an efficient implementation of low-pass filters, often used for decimation and interpolation.
CIC filter can be configured:
– in single CIC filter with Sinc4 or Sinc5 order (for high-resolution low-pass decimation filter usually selected for audio applications, such as speech capture from digital microphones)
– in two CIC filters with Sinc1, Sinc2, Sinc3 or FastSinc order (to offer a main filter path for acquisition and an auxiliary filter for fast-event generation (for the out-off-limit detector - OLD))

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_ReshapeFilterActivation
RefParameter.Description: Activation of reshaping filter mainly dedicated to the audio application but also usable in other applications.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_ReshapeFilterDecimationRatio
RefParameter.Description: The samples at the reshape filter output can be decimated by four (4) or not (1)

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_HighPassFilterActivation
RefParameter.Description:
"The high-pass filter suppresses the low-frequency content from the final output data stream in case of continuous conversion mode.
This filter is useful when there is parasitic low-frequency noise (or DC signal) in the input data source and it must be removed from the final data."

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_HighPassCutOffFrequency
RefParameter.Description:
Cut-off freqency of the high-pass filter :
FPCM represents the sampling frequency at HPF input

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_IntegratorActivation
RefParameter.Description: The Integrator performs additional decimation and a resolution increase of data coming from the digital filter.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_IntegratorValue
RefParameter.Description: Value is the amount of integrated values.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_IntegratorOutputDivision
RefParameter.Description: In order to control the data width at the integrator output, the resulting data can be divided by 1, 4, 32 or 128.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADDetector
RefParameter.Description: Sound activity detector mode.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADFrameSize
RefParameter.Description: Size of one frame to compute short-term signal level.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADTriggerEvent

PossibleValue.Comment: when Sound Activity Detector enters the MONITOR state
when Sound Activity Detector enters or exits the DETECT state

RefParameter.Description:
Sound trigger event configuration :
An event indicates when the Sound Activity Detector (SAD) enters and/or exits the DETECT state. This event is used to generate an interrupt when a sound is detected or when a sound is no longer detected.
Either the application receives an event only when the SAD enters the DETECT state (or MONITOR state).
Or the application receives an event when the SAD enters or exits the DETECT state.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADHangoverWindow
RefParameter.Description: Hangover time window in frames

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADHangoverWindow
RefParameter.Comment: Number of frames for hangover time window

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADLearningFrames
RefParameter.Description: Number of learning frames for the first estimation of noise level.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADAmbientNoiseSlope
RefParameter.Description: Ambient noise slope control.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADSignalNoiseThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Signal to noise threshold.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SADSoundLevelInterrupt
RefParameter.Description: This interrupt is mainly used for debug purpose.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_AcquisitionMode
RefParameter.Description:
Asynchronous, continuous mode allows the application to start a continuous acquisition
Asynchronous, single-shot mode allows the application to start the acquisition of one sample
Synchronous, continuous mode allows the application to start a continuous acquisition by using trigger source
Synchronous, single-shot mode allows the application to start a single acquisition by using trigger source
Window, continuous mode allows the application to start or stop a continuous acquisition by consecutive edges of using trigger source
Window, snapshot mode allows the application to store when a trigger occurs, the last valid sample, the current decimation value of CIC and the sample counter of the integrator are stored whereas the DFLT is continuously acquiring the samples

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_TriggerSource
RefParameter.Description:
Digital filter trigger signal selection, select which external signals trigger for the corresponding filter
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_TriggerSource

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Instance5 -> OLD5 has to be configured
ADF1 Sound Activity Detection has to be configured

RefParameter.Description:
Digital filter trigger signal selection, select which external signals trigger for the corresponding filter
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_TriggerEdge
RefParameter.Description:
Edge to use on the trigger source.
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SCDActivation

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: SCD not available when Data Source is connected to ADC interface

RefParameter.Description: The SCD detects, with a very fast response time, if an analog signal reached saturated values (out-of-full scale ranges) and remained on this value for a given time.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SCDThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Threshold defines the max consecutive 1's or 0's which will generate an event.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_SCDBreakSignal
RefParameter.Description: Break signal defines the signal to use when the threshold is reached.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_OLDActivation

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Change CIC Mode of the DFLT (cannot be Sinc4 or Sinc5)

RefParameter.Description:
"The OLD triggers an event when a signal reaches or crosses given maximum and minimum threshold values.
The generated event drives a break signals when conditions are met.
Warning : The OLD can be used only if the CIC filter is configured in motor and sensing mode (not vailable for CIC Mode = Sinc4 or Sinc5)"

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_OLDCicMode
RefParameter.Description: CIC filter can be configured with Sinc1, Sinc2, Sinc3 or FastSinc order.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_OLDDecimationRatio
RefParameter.Description: Decimation ration of the OLD CIC filter.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_OLDEventConfig
RefParameter.Description: Define when the OLD generates an event.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_OLDBreakSignal
RefParameter.Description: Break signal defines the signal to use when the threshold is reached.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_OLDHighThreshold
RefParameter.Description:
High Threshold for out-of-limit detector. Has to be strictly greater than Low Threshold
Min = Low Threshold + 1
Max = 33554431

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT5_OLDLowThreshold
RefParameter.Description:
Low Threshold for out-of-limit detector. Has to be strictly lower than High Threshold
Min = -33554432
Max = High Threshold - 1

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT_Delay
RefParameter.Description:
The delay is performed by discarding a given number of samples from the selected input stream, before samples enter into the CIC filter.
This data discarding is performed by skipping a given number of data strobe, preventing the CIC filter to take into account those data.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT_Decimation
RefParameter.Description:
The maximum allowed decimation ratio for the CIC filter is depending on the input data size and the CIC order.
See reference manual to help the calculation in order to insure that the data size does not exceed the CIC capability.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT_Offset
RefParameter.Description:
Offset error compensation.
This field represents the value to be subtracted to the signal provided by the CIC filter and before going to the SCALE which adjusts the amplitude of the signal

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT_Gain
RefParameter.Description:
The gain definition defines the amplitude adjustment of the signal provided by the CIC filter, by steps of 3 dB : from -48db (-16) to 72dB (24).
To get the best MDF performances, it is important to properly adjust the gain value. See Reference Manual to clculate the best value.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT_FifoThreshold
RefParameter.Description: Define which event generates a data transfer from the FIFO to the bus.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_DFLT_DiscardSamples
RefParameter.Description: Here is the amount of samples to be discarded after each restart

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_InterleavedFilters
RefParameter.Description:
Number of filters in interleaved mode.
The number of interleaved SITF is from the SITF0 up to the number of SITF.
Warning : the ADC interface cannot be used in the interleaved Mode.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_InterleavedFilters

PossibleValue.Comment: DFLT0, DFLT1, DFLT2, DFLT3 and DFLT4
DFLT0, DFLT1, DFLT2, DFLT3, DFLT4 and DFLT5

RefParameter.Description:
Number of filters in interleaved mode.
The number of interleaved SITF is from the SITF0 up to the number of SITF.
Warning : the ADC interface cannot be used in the interleaved Mode.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_ProcClockDivider
RefParameter.Description:
The digital processing is performed using only the kernel clock which can be divided by this value.
This divider is used to adjust the frequency of the clock provided to the SITF.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_ActivationOutputClock

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: CCK0 or CCK1 have to be activated

RefParameter.Description: Activate Common Clock 0 and/or 1 as output clocks

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_Pins

PossibleValue.Comment: CCK0 is used as output clock
CCK1 is used as output clock
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate Common Clock 1 in the Common Clocks Mode (if exist)

PossibleValue.Comment: CCK0 and CCK1 are used as output clock
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate Common Clock 0 and Common Clock 1 in the Common Clocks Mode (if exist)

RefParameter.Description: Select which common clocks have to be defined as output clocks

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_Divider
RefParameter.Description:
This divider is used to adjust the frequency of the MDF_CCK clock.
The input clock of this divider is the clock provided to the SITF (see Processing clock divider parameter)

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_ActivationClockTrigger
RefParameter.Description:
Trigger to start the output Clock Divider. divider can be triggered on the rising or falling edge of one of the 16 trigger sources.
This feature can be helpful to synchronize the clock generation to a timer event.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_Clock_Source
RefParameter.Description:
Clock trigger signal choice selects which external signal has to used to trigger the common clock activation
This allows to synchronize the common clocks of several MDF instances, or to synchronize the common clock generation to a timer event.
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_Clock_Source

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: ADF1 Sound Activity Detection has to be configured

RefParameter.Description:
Clock trigger signal choice selects which external signal has to used to trigger the common clock activation
This allows to synchronize the common clocks of several MDF instances, or to synchronize the common clock generation to a timer event.
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_COMPARAM_Clock_Edge
RefParameter.Description:
Edge to use on the trigger source.
When the trigger source is TRGO, the sensitivity is forced to falling edge.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_ADF_InstanceToActivate

PossibleValue.Comment: Activate at least one Instance in the Mode menu above
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate at least one Instance in the Mode menu above

RefParameter.Description: In order to activate MDF, common clocks activation in the mode menu is not enough, please activate at least one instance in the above Mode menu.

RefParameter.Name: MDF_ADF_InstanceToActivate

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Activate ADF in the Mode menu above

RefParameter.Description: In order to activate ADF, common clocks activation in the mode menu is not enough, please activate ADF instance in the above Mode menu.
